segment.source: Group, filter, and search issues
segment.target: Group, filter, and search issues

segment.source: Group, filter, and search issues
segment.target: Group, filter, and search issues

segment.source: Group, filter, and search issues
segment.target: Group, filter, and search issues

segment.source: This topic provides an overview of assessment results.
segment.target: This topic provides an overview of assessment results.

segment.source: It also describes how to open multiple results and then group, filter, and sort the issues to find the information that you need.
segment.target: It also describes how to open multiple results and then group, filter, and sort the issues to find the information that you need.

segment.source: Results show information about what the assessment discovered when it ran.
segment.target: Results show information about what the assessment discovered when it ran.

segment.source: The results include metrics that describe what the assessment measured, issues that the assessment found based on the measurements, and recommendations to help you resolve any issues.
segment.target: The results include metrics that describe what the assessment measured, issues that the assessment found based on the measurements, and recommendations to help you resolve any issues.

segment.source: Some recommendations include links to additional information or links to Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA).
segment.target: Some recommendations include links to additional information or links to Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA).

segment.source: These links help you trace the cause of an issue back to the source.
segment.target: These links help you trace the cause of an issue back to the source.

segment.source: You can open individual results or multiple results from a list of all results.
segment.target: You can open individual results or multiple results from a list of all results.

segment.source: A summary view is available for comparing multiple results.
segment.target: A summary view is available for comparing multiple results.

segment.source: But by default, when you open results in the Windows Assessment Console, they open in the details view.
segment.target: But by default, when you open results in the Windows Assessment Console, they open in the details view.

segment.source: The details view of results consists of:
segment.target: The details view of results consists of:

segment.source: Run information.
segment.target: Run information.

segment.source: The first table in the details view contains the run information.
segment.target: The first table in the details view contains the run information.

segment.source: The run information provides data about the computer that the job ran on, in addition to the total issues, errors, and warnings that the job produced on that computer.
segment.target: The run information provides data about the computer that the job ran on, in addition to the total issues, errors, and warnings that the job produced on that computer.

segment.source: Click Select rows to add or remove run information from the table.
segment.target: Click Select rows to add or remove run information from the table.

segment.source: Assessment results.
segment.target: Assessment results.

segment.source: Assessment results for each assessment that the job ran appear after the run information table.
segment.target: Assessment results for each assessment that the job ran appear after the run information table.

segment.source: The assessment results contain 5 categories of information: errors, warnings, issues, metrics, and assessment settings.
segment.target: The assessment results contain 5 categories of information: errors, warnings, issues, metrics, and assessment settings.

segment.source: To expand or collapse a row, click the chevron at the start of each row.
segment.target: To expand or collapse a row, click the chevron at the start of each row.

segment.source: A details pane.
segment.target: A details pane.

segment.source: When you click an individual cell in the tables, more information appears in the details pane on the right.
segment.target: When you click an individual cell in the tables, more information appears in the details pane on the right.

segment.source: The details pane is visible by default, but you can collapse it to give more screen space to results.
segment.target: The details pane is visible by default, but you can collapse it to give more screen space to results.

segment.source: A metric chart.
segment.target: A metric chart.

segment.source: Each assessment has a chart icon by the assessment name.
segment.target: Each assessment has a chart icon by the assessment name.

segment.source: You can click the chart icon to graph all the metrics.
segment.target: You can click the chart icon to graph all the metrics.

segment.source: The top-level metrics also have associated bar charts.
segment.target: The top-level metrics also have associated bar charts.

segment.source: To simplify or extend the graph, click the colored bar next to the result that you want to add to the graph or remove from the graph.
segment.target: To simplify or extend the graph, click the colored bar next to the result that you want to add to the graph or remove from the graph.

segment.source: To return to the original graph, click the colored bar next to the assessment name.
segment.target: To return to the original graph, click the colored bar next to the assessment name.

segment.source: Issues are a key part of the results.
segment.target: Issues are a key part of the results.

segment.source: They identify potential problems with a computer configuration or performance based on measurements that the assessment records.
segment.target: They identify potential problems with a computer configuration or performance based on measurements that the assessment records.

segment.source: The job reports the total number of issues that it found and the number of issues that it found for each assessment.
segment.target: The job reports the total number of issues that it found and the number of issues that it found for each assessment.

segment.source: If more than one issue occurs, you can expand the issue to see more information.
segment.target: If more than one issue occurs, you can expand the issue to see more information.

segment.source: You can also click an individual issue to see recommended remediation and more analysis information in the details pane.
segment.target: You can also click an individual issue to see recommended remediation and more analysis information in the details pane.

segment.source: To open results
segment.target: To open results

segment.source: In the Windows Assessment Console, click Options, and then click Open Results.
segment.target: In the Windows Assessment Console, click Options, and then click Open Results.

segment.source: A list of all results from the results library appears.
segment.target: A list of all results from the results library appears.

segment.source: Select one or more results, and then click Open.
segment.target: Select one or more results, and then click Open.

segment.source: To select an individual result, select the check box that appears in the left column.
segment.target: To select an individual result, select the check box that appears in the left column.

segment.source: To select multiple results, click the data and drag the mouse, or click the data and then use either the Shift key or the Ctrl key to select the results that you want.
segment.target: To select multiple results, click the data and drag the mouse, or click the data and then use either the Shift key or the Ctrl key to select the results that you want.

segment.source: To group issues in the assessment results table
segment.target: To group issues in the assessment results table

segment.source: On the View Results page, in the assessment results table, click the chevron next to Issues to expand the issues.
segment.target: On the View Results page, in the assessment results table, click the chevron next to Issues to expand the issues.

segment.source: Right-click Issues, and then on the Group by menu, select a category to group by.
segment.target: Right-click Issues, and then on the Group by menu, select a category to group by.

segment.source: Each assessment can have different grouping categories.
segment.target: Each assessment can have different grouping categories.

segment.source: For example, you might see:
segment.target: For example, you might see:

segment.source: (None).
segment.target: (None).

segment.source: Don’t group issues.
segment.target: Don’t group issues.

segment.source: Category.
segment.target: Category.

segment.source: Group issues by category.
segment.target: Group issues by category.

segment.source: Each issues is categorized by the type of performance impact that the assessment has detected.
segment.target: Each issues is categorized by the type of performance impact that the assessment has detected.

segment.source: Type ID.
segment.target: Type ID.

segment.source: Group issues based on an ID.
segment.target: Group issues based on an ID.

segment.source: Each issue is associated with a type ID that defines a group of similar issues across multiple categories.
segment.target: Each issue is associated with a type ID that defines a group of similar issues across multiple categories.

segment.source: Test case.
segment.target: Test case.

segment.source: Group issues based on which test case or workload was being exercised when the assessment discovered the issue.
segment.target: Group issues based on which test case or workload was being exercised when the assessment discovered the issue.

segment.source: Manufacturer.
segment.target: Manufacturer.

segment.source: Group issues based on the manufacturer, if the manufacturer is identified in the issue.
segment.target: Group issues based on the manufacturer, if the manufacturer is identified in the issue.

segment.source: Process.
segment.target: Process.

segment.source: Group issues based on processes, if they're identified in the issue.
segment.target: Group issues based on processes, if they're identified in the issue.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can also right-click Total issues in the run information table to group issues in that table.
segment.target: You can also right-click Total issues in the run information table to group issues in that table.

segment.source: To sort issues across multiple jobs
segment.target: To sort issues across multiple jobs

segment.source: On the View Results page, in the assessment results table, click the chevron next to Issues to expand the issues.
segment.target: On the View Results page, in the assessment results table, click the chevron next to Issues to expand the issues.

segment.source: Right-click Issues, and then click either Sort ascending or Sort descending to sort the columns for various job results.
segment.target: Right-click Issues, and then click either Sort ascending or Sort descending to sort the columns for various job results.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can also right-click Total issues in the run information table to sort the columns for various job results based on the number of total issues in each job.
segment.target: You can also right-click Total issues in the run information table to sort the columns for various job results based on the number of total issues in each job.

segment.source: To search for issues in the details pane
segment.target: To search for issues in the details pane

segment.source: On the View Results page, in the assessment results table, click Issues.
segment.target: On the View Results page, in the assessment results table, click Issues.

segment.source: Details for each issue appear in the details pane on the right.
segment.target: Details for each issue appear in the details pane on the right.

segment.source: In the details pane, type any word in the Filter issues box.
segment.target: In the details pane, type any word in the Filter issues box.

segment.source: To filter issues in the details pane
segment.target: To filter issues in the details pane

segment.source: On the View Results page, in the assessment results table, click Issues.
segment.target: On the View Results page, in the assessment results table, click Issues.

segment.source: Details for each issue appear in the details pane on the right.
segment.target: Details for each issue appear in the details pane on the right.

segment.source: In the details pane, click the green plus sign () next to the Filter issues box, and then select filter criteria.
segment.target: In the details pane, click the green plus sign () next to the Filter issues box, and then select filter criteria.

segment.source: Different assessments have different filter criteria.
segment.target: Different assessments have different filter criteria.

segment.source: The default relational expression appears next to the filter criteria that you selected.
segment.target: The default relational expression appears next to the filter criteria that you selected.

segment.source: Click the relational expression and select one that you want to use.
segment.target: Click the relational expression and select one that you want to use.

segment.source: Depending on the metadata filters that you use, these relational expressions are available:
segment.target: Depending on the metadata filters that you use, these relational expressions are available:

segment.source: equals
segment.target: equals

segment.source: not equals
segment.target: not equals

segment.source: less than
segment.target: less than

segment.source: greater than
segment.target: greater than

segment.source: less than or equal
segment.target: less than or equal

segment.source: greater than or equal
segment.target: greater than or equal

segment.source: starts with
segment.target: starts with

segment.source: ends with
segment.target: ends with

segment.source: contains
segment.target: contains

segment.source: not contains
segment.target: not contains

segment.source: between
segment.target: between

segment.source: regex
segment.target: regex

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The term regex refers to regular expressions.
segment.target: The term regex refers to regular expressions.

segment.source: For more information, see Regular Expression Language Elements.
segment.target: For more information, see Regular Expression Language Elements.

segment.source: In the box, enter the metadata value that you want to filter on.
segment.target: In the box, enter the metadata value that you want to filter on.

segment.source: To add filter criteria, repeat these steps.
segment.target: To add filter criteria, repeat these steps.

segment.source: To remove filter criteria, click the X next to them.
segment.target: To remove filter criteria, click the X next to them.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Windows Assessment Console

segment.target: Windows Assessment Console common scenarios
